The **Primeval Lead**, also called *Tàisù Jīn* (太素金), or **Dan Earth Yellow**, is refined from *húfěn* (胡粉) transformed into *qiān bái* (铅白). It is also named *Qīngjīn* (青金), another appellation for *Tàisù Jīn*. Its name aligns with the **Great Yang** (太阳), harmonized and refined through alchemical processes. When drained, it yields a **Celestial Indigo Elixir (青丹天玄)**, also called the **Suppressed Indigo Elixir (伏玄丹)**.

Its preparation involves using *qiān huā* (铅华) as the **Flower Pool**, into which *shuǐyín* (水银) is introduced as the **Double Flower Elixir**. When fused in the crucible and burned into medicine, any residual *qiān jiāng* (铅浆) is of no use.

The above describes the **refined essence of lead (铅精)**, whose alchemical function is supreme and whose transformations are boundless. Those of shallow understanding grasp only its outward form, unable to seek its true essence. They recklessly adulterate it with foreign substances, corrupting its pure and refined essence.

Those who seek ultimate truth must pursue **true lead (真铅)**, ensuring no impurities are mixed.

---
**Pairing with White Cinnabar (白丹砂) – Seventh and Sixth Classifications**

1. **Heaven-Born Sprout Cinnabar (天生芽丹砂)**, known as **White Cinnabar (白丹砂)**.
   The **Suppressed Primordial Spirit-Qi of the Great Yang (伏元神炁太阳)** is called **Natural Qi (自然之炁)**.
   It contains the **Essence of Fire (含火之精)**, named **Spiritual Cinnabar (灵砂)**. Among all cinnabars, its sprouts grow longest. As recorded in the *Dan Book* (丹书) *Huáng Lù Jì* (黄录记):
   *"True cinnabar resembles true pearls; thus, the Immortals named it **True Pearl Cinnabar (真珠砂)**, also called **Heaven-Born Sprout (天生芽)**."*

   Directly refining *gōng* (汞/mercury) without additional medicines, this cinnabar, when applied, causes mercury—regardless of quantity—to **suppress fire** upon exposure. It can **transform barren mercury into efficacy**, refining it to a golden hue. It can also **transmute the Five Metals into treasure**.

2. **Immortal Cinnabar (仙砂)**.
   Immortals require no external medicines for their elixir substance, nor do they use artificial crucibles or tripods. They simply ingest this white cinnabar to achieve longevity. They do not refine mercury into an elixir; thus, Immortals designate it as **White Cinnabar (白丹砂)**—the **Heaven-Born Sprout**.

3. **Vermilion Black Cinnabar (朱乌砂)**.
   This cinnabar originates from the **Southern Palace of the Fire Deity (离宫南方)**, belonging to Fire. Its name derives from its association with the Southern direction.

4. **Mercury Cinnabar (汞砂)**.
   Named for its unoxidized, pristine white form resembling sand.

5. **Stone Spleen Cinnabar (石脾砂)**.
   This cinnabar is found in **stone beds (石床)** or between layered stones, appearing white and resembling stone in color.

6. **Red Emperor’s Salt (赤帝卤咸)**.
   The Southern direction belongs to the **Red Emperor (赤帝)**. This cinnabar resembles white grains of salt, symbolizing its name. Immortals classify it differently.

---
**Pairing with Gold (金) – Eighth and Fourth Classifications**

1. **Regal White Gold (庚辛白金)**.
   Gold is numbered four, hence its four names. Originally formless, it is symbolized by the **Western direction (西方)**, associated with *Gēng* (庚) and *Xīn* (辛).
   Thus, one understands the **Immortal Dao’s divine transformations**, where *qi* is paired and refined to form substances. It is unclear whether mercury originates from **golden water** or if gold itself is unfit for elixir-making. The Immortals’ symbolic teachings cannot be measured by conventional logic.

   **Regal White Gold (庚辛白金)** is not formed from metallic gold but from **natural *qi*, creating a treasure of great transformation**. It is not artificial gold but the accumulation of ingested gold, refining the body into a **divine, transformed essence**. Thus, the **Great Dao is profound and mysterious**, beyond the grasp of ordinary minds.

2. **Primeval Lead (太素金)**—its name reflects its original essence.
3. **束方 Day-Sun (束方日阳)**.
4. **Mao Wood Green-Gold (卯木青金)**—named after the **Three Sovereigns**, with Huangdi later establishing its title.
   *束方 Day-Sun* is also called **Male Left (男左)**, representing **Mao Wood Green-Gold (卯木青金)**, all crafted by Immortals under distinct names.

The **Three Sovereigns** paired with the Western direction. Later, the **Great Sage (太上)** traveled to the **Flowing Sands (流沙)**, refining true lead into medicine, all originating from the teachings of *Gēng* and *Xīn*.

This is the **law of the Primordial Lord (元始君)**, who established symbols for humanity, who otherwise could not naturally form metallic substances. Thus, through ingesting gold, one achieves a **spiritually transformed body**.

Later, in the **Year of the Tortoise Shell (龟甲元年)**, the **Emperor’s succession was disrupted by violent upheaval**, leading to the decline of the age and the Immortals’ withdrawal. The human world temporarily lost the **Primordial Teachings (元教)**, and no divine-transformed gold existed as an ultimate elixir.

In the **Year of the Tortoise Shell’s Upper Primordial (龟甲上元元年)**, the Immortal **Lóu Jìng (娄敬)** instructed the use of **water sand (水砂)** to extract gold for elixir-making. He excavated **Yīn Mountain (阴山)**, mining silver ore and extracting **white gold**, causing immense labor for the people. Due to the **tyrannical rule of the worldly emperor**, the lack of harmony between ruler and subjects, and the people’s resentment, the **Dao was severed**, and the **teachings of life and death were disrupted**. The people fled to the plains, blaming the **Heavenly Dao**.

Afterward, when Immortals descended into the world, hiding among mortals, they gradually transformed society. **Divine gold (灵金)** emerged, and people came to enjoy medicines, valuing gold and treasures as mere dust. The world achieved great peace, and the people no longer resented the **Heavenly Dao**.

---
In the **Highest Antiquity**, when Heaven and Earth first divided, the **Five Phases (金木水火土)** had not yet aligned, nor had deceitful artifices arisen. People lived in simplicity, and the **Sages governed above**, the **Immortal Teachings** faithfully observed.

Later, **Huangdi established the calendar and the Five Phases**—though it is unclear who first systematized them in antiquity. Seeking the **ultimate elixir to save lives**, all claimed the **Three Sovereigns** had created it. At the time, there were no reliable records, and **green inscriptions (绿文字)** had not yet appeared. Later, those who attained the Dao relied on **seclusion from the world**.

The Immortals left behind **laws and teachings**, naming medicines and recording them in **verifiable annals**. Countless later practitioners refined and attained the Dao.

According to ancient records, **Emperor Míng (明帝)** first obtained the **ultimate elixir**, then passed the **Treasure of the Throne** downward. Eventually, it reached **Yu of Xia (夏禹)**. The **people’s desires were too hasty**; Yu did not await the **treasures of the feudal lords**, and though he benefited from the elixir, his reign was too brief to fully harmonize with the lords. Thus, the **Treasure of the Throne** passed to **Qǐ (启)**, and the **Imperial elixir tradition vanished from the world**.

chunks.original_text: 虽然臣下多得之，隐而不显，或处市朝，或秘山林，乐道者一时观至宝焉，非人问土石水砂所出也。 后学者切要知我识我，玄元大造化之金也。 配合确砂相类门第九五名 一名狙砂，其物出於阴山，积冰凝之，结水变成也。 二名赤狙砂，带赤色者，老壮堪用，无物不利。 三名炮砂，此砂人不解用，兼不知来处，损物坏人。 四名白海砂，其砂咸，如海水结成，绿北庭凝寒之地，状如白雪，土咸如卤，故号白海砂，实堪服食，为至药。 五名五金贼，其名因化五金，始知是贼。 若解用则五金不坏，若不解用是物必坏。 其砂若相类用之，不得过甚，但得力即止，过多即损物。 如人要服食，疾愈即休。 欲求他力，多服之，即必速死，何也。 此砂出自毒山，积阴之熙，而凝结成砂。 若劫力则得物成之后，宜退之。 若用过多，所服必死，速坏五藏，五金必败，万万如此矣。 若得其妙理识我真确砂，仙人用之通大道。 配合口硝石相类门第十四名 一名硝石，是秋石阴石也。 出积寒凝霜之土地而生，取此霜土，煎炼淋漓如法结成，亦如煮水成盥。 然用处各别，绿性较寒，取北方坎子为炁，积阴而用，制阳之毒。 上古仙人将制物，兼化五金成宝，假合成道。 二名北帝玄珠，其源采北方之炁，化成玄珠，是冰霜之炁，与炮砂相邻，作法则又与炮砂性不同。 确砂能导引诸药，硝石能制伏之，是其性不同也。 确砂是阳石炁，硝石是阴石炁。 三名乌头，其名因秋叶黄落时霜始降，因而得名，是草枯之意。 四名黄乌首，时疡北向，首迎霜，而采之。 仙人用制巨阳之大毒，故列名相类，与圣道抗行，作世利之门，而用即通。 此间之妙也。 偏治女人血炁块。 配合空青相类门第十一 三名 一名空青，色带雌，如阴中之炁，带雌配类，西方之炁象，乃西方庚辛金，白虎之炁也。 绿曾青配类，束方甲乙木雄，乃东方甲乙木精，青龙之炁也。 空青象西方庚辛金，金木相化，木之炁克於金，而怀金性。 二事名一，用类不同。 曾青能制伏水银，为使属阳，乃雄。 空青性弱体空，遂名空青，属阴。 乃雌能感曾青之炁，而成制药也。 如世上空青杂用，及合诸服食药，总得即不堪对。 水银定伏，三黄为使，用即乖矣。 二名青腰中女，其名中女，谓不同水银之炁，与水银同和，无男太阳之力，故得中女之名也。 三名青砂，乃空青中心空忽，有怀一银星子，中有一粒，青如麻子大，可以为至药，服食便得长生。 亦名玄珠，又名为玄砂。 若分配合造药物，不得其门，妄施劳力。 知者不妄，空青中还丹自然之药，仙士知之，服而不死。 空青有银星子，乃阴，是雌。 曾青中有金星子，乃阳，是雄。 能为水银之使，可以定服三黄之大，诀也。 空中青子，为天生芽，自然神丹也。 配合闷黄芽真性相类门第十二四名 一名黄芽铅，能制汞，谓之黄芽。 其铅须三才全不损伤者，可为黄芽。 将制汞，先白后黄，转成五彩色，各执一方，始为芽，全其大道之功。 二名白丹砂，是为黄芽。 其白丹砂，是朱乌真胎体之骨，直下制汞，为道初地，力通神化。 先白后带黄晕，后复五方之色，得其兑，兑是庚辛金之药，化汞变成象也。 经云：采铅之精炁，为天生芽。 三名硫黄，亦名黄芽。

2. **Red true cinnabar (赤狙砂)**, bearing a reddish hue—whether aged or fresh, it benefits all things without harm.
3. **Cannon sand (炮砂)**, which people neither understand nor know its source; it damages substances and harms the body.
4. **White sea sand (白海砂)**, a saline sand resembling frozen seawater, found in the **glacial north** (绿北庭), resembling white snow, with an earthly taste like brine—thus named. It is **fit for ingestion** and serves as the **Ultimate Elixir**.
5. **Five Metals’ Thief (五金贼)**, so named because it **corrupts the Five Metals**. If used correctly, the metals remain unharmed; if misused, they are ruined. When applied in moderation, it yields strength—but overuse **destroys the body’s organs**, weakens the Five Metals, and brings swift death. This sand originates from **Poison Mountain**, where accumulated **yin-qi** congeals into its form. If forced, it must be withdrawn after formation; excessive use **guarantees death**, swiftly ravaging the **Five Viscera** and the Five Metals.

Those who grasp its **mysterious principle** and recognize **True Cinnabar** attain the Dao through its use.

4. **Yellow Aconite (黄乌首)**, is harvested when **ulcers face north**, its head **welcoming the frost**. If **Orpiment is carelessly mixed** with other elixirs, it **fails to harmonize**. Once mercury is **fixed**, the **Three Yellows (三黄)** serve as messengers—but their union **becomes discordant**.
2. **Midriff’s Maiden (青腰中女)**, named for its **non-mercury qi**, blending with mercury yet lacking **Male Taiyang’s force**, hence its **feminine designation**.
3. **Green Sand (青砂)**, Orpiment’s **central hollow**, containing a **silver star**—a single grain, **pea-sized and green**, serving as the **Ultimate Elixir**. Ingesting it grants **longevity**. Also called **Mysterious Pearl (玄珠)** or **Mysterious Sand (玄砂)**. Without proper **alchemical pairing**, reckless labor yields nothing. When refining mercury, it first **whitens**, then **yellows**, shifting through **Five Colors**, each governing a direction—only then does it **sprout**, fulfilling the **Great Dao’s function**.

This **White Cinnabar Sand** is the **true embryo of Vermilion Ape (朱乌)**, its **skeletal essence** directly subduing mercury—marking the **initial stage of the Dao**, its power **transcending mortal limits**. It first **whitens**, then **glows yellow**, before manifesting the **Five Directions’ hues**, achieving **harmony (兑)**—the **Regent-Xīn Metals’ medicine**, transforming mercury into its **symbolic form**. The **Sulfur (硫黄)** used to subdue mercury is indeed temporary—though it may dwell, it ultimately **flee**. If the **Ghost Flame (鬼焰)** is not severed, the **poisonous qi (毒炁)** lingers, and mercury remains afflicted. Even if one briefly **overcomes the fire (伏火)**, it is still **unbearable to ingest (不堪服)**, and only **treatments for illness (疗病)** may suffice. Different substances belong to distinct lineages—none can **prolong the dwelling (延驻)**; they will **harm in the end (终害人)**.

The verse says:
*"Heaven-born sprout (天生芽), White Cinnabar Sand (白丹砂),
Uniting the two **qi (炁)**, as one kin (一家).
No deviation in the path (路不错), entering **Divine Transformation (神华)**—
The Dao lies here (道在此), this is the **River Vehicle (河车)**."*

The **Fourth Name: Lead-Yellow Flower White Cinnabar Sprout (铅黄华白丹芽)**—within lead, there is silver, hence its extraction by method. Obtaining silver’s **refined qi (精炁)**, it is called **White Cinnabar Sprout (白丹芽)**. **White Cinnabar Sprout (白丹芽)** is the **embryo formed by qi (炁结成胎)**, the essence of silver. Its **silver’s refined qi (银精炁)** subdues mercury as medicine, embodying the **Dao of Immortals (神仙之道)**. If used without harming the **Three Powers (三才)** and preserving its **qi-force (炁力)**, the verse declares:
*"Lead-Yellow Sprout (铅黄芽), perfecting the **Three Flowers (三华)**,
Extract my **qi (炁)**, forming the Sand (结成砂).
Initially white (初门白), refining fire (运火加),
Cycling the **Five Colors (轮五彩)**, rising like clouds and mists (起云霞).
**Green Vitriol (曾青)** as the agent—
The **Great Dao (大道)** knows no deceit (无邪),
With three complete, it is the **family of Immortals (仙家)**."*

The **Sprout (芽)**, born of **Heaven, Earth, and Humanity (天地人三才)**, is fully named as such. The **Sprout (芽)** contains the **qi of Heaven and Earth (天地之炁)**, giving rise to all **ten thousand forms (万类)**. Its root is **unbroken and continuous (绵绵不断)**, hence it is called **Sprout (芽)**.

**White Cinnabar Sand (白丹砂)** is the **precious essence (宝精)** of mercury. When used to subdue mercury, it acts as **lord and minister (如君如臣)**—none can fail to **respond (相禀)**. Mercury, over **four thousand years (四千年)**, transforms into **Cinnabar (朱砂)**, then into **gold (金)**, and finally into **White Tiger (白虎)**, the **stone-fluid (石液)** of ages. Yet even the **Immortal Teachings (仙教)** often vary—when one attains its **form and spirit (形神)**, it too **shifts and changes (变改)**. Before it is named **True Cinnabar Sand (真丹砂)**, the **green mercury (绿水银)** remains unstable in nature.

Only **White Cinnabar Sand (白朱砂)**, called by Immortals **Primordial Origin Sand (玄元砂)**, endures **ten thousand years (万载)** without alteration. Its **Primordial White nature (元白之性)** differs from mercury’s. The **Sand (砂)** is like a **worldly ruler (世国主)**—though human in form, its **qi (炁)** differs from the common. **Life and death are in its grasp (生杀在手)**, and **transformation is in its mind (变化在心)**. So too with **White Cinnabar Sand (白丹砂)**—only then does one know this **Sand (砂)** is the **Primordial Origin’s beginning (玄元之首)**.

None but those who **already possess Immortal Dao (宿有仙道者)** can obtain it by extraction. If alchemists wish to **attain the Heaven-born Sprout (天生芽)**, they must seek **Primordial Origin Sand (玄元砂)**—which is precisely the **Heaven-born Sprout (天生芽)** and **White Cinnabar Sand (白丹砂)**. Near the earth it does not grow—it thrives in **distant mountains (远山)**. Mountains hold **Kān-Lǐ caves (坎离之穴)**, yet alchemists cannot penetrate deeply. To extract my **Primordial Origin (玄元)**, one must **fathom the unfathomable depths of the Sand (莫测丹之浅深)**. Only **Jinzhou Cinnabar (锦州朱砂)**, refined into **precious grains (成颗者)**, is taken—by method, its **qi is drawn (抽晕)**, then **restored to its original form (却归旧体)**. **Overcoming the fire (伏火)** without harming the **Dao (道)**, it is also named **Yellow Sprout (黄芽)**.

It **sequentially subdues mercury (递相承制汞)**—like **minister meeting sovereign (臣见君)**, like **fire encountering kindling (火见薪)**, like **wind meeting clouds (风得云)**—none fails to **be overcome (不伏)**. Yet after **completing the Sand (成丹之后)**, it **cannot be ingested (不堪服食)**. Some may **craft it for worldly gain (制为世利)**, or **偶然 heal ailments (偶以愈疾)**, but it **never fulfills transcendence (终无出世之功)**—this can be **verified (验)**.

After **one or two years (一二年)** of ingestion, **men’s yang pathways (阳道)** are **severed (俱绝)**—for **pure yin accumulates (纯阴之所积)**. Fellow seekers of the **Later Teachings (后学同志)**, follow only the **Ancient Teachings (古教)**. If one extracts this **Sand (砂)** and ingests it, **none will fail to attain the Dao (无不成道)**.

**Green and White Cinnabar Sand (绿白丹砂)** is the **medicine of nature (自然之药)**. The method **encompasses the Three Powers (三才)**—using **Heaven and Earth as the furnace (天地为炉)**, the **Four Seasons as fuel (四时为炭)**. **Passing through water and fire (经水过火)**, enduring **kalpas (劫)**, it **refines into substance (成质焉)**. Alchemists must know—**wondrous Dao is not distant (妙道不远)**.

If one obtains this **Sand (砂)** and ingests it, simply **removing impurities (去却夹石)**, grinding it into **powder (研炼如粉面)**, with **nine steams (蒸)** as the measure. **Grinding it a hundred times (研及百过)**, like **Indian ink (如缅)**, forming **pills with date kernels (枣禳)** or **rotten rice (烂饭)**. The **pills (丸)**, the size of **mung beans (蒙豆)**, are taken **one daily (日服一丸)**—never more. Its **qi (炁)** is as **ingested (如服)**.

After **one or two years (一二年)**, one may **attain transcendence (出世之功)**. Before **leisurely observation (闲观)**, it **differs from common folk (与常人不同)**. Its **refined light shines like the sun (精光耀日)**, its **qi (炁)** **naturally luminous (自明达)**.

The **principles of the Ultimate Dao (至道之理)** lie solely in **containing the essence and returning to the origin (含精返本)**, nourishing the **Divine qi (资神炁)**. Extracting its **true fluid (真液)**, restoring it to the **Primordial Ancestor (元祖)**, filling the **blood and marrow (填其血脑)**, one **naturally grows young again (老而复少)**, **withers and flourishes anew (枯而复荣)**. Thus the classics say:
*"Quicklime cast into charcoal fire (胡粉投炭火), its form destroyed, returns as lead (色坏还为铅).
Ice and snow plunged into warm broth (冰雪入温汤), dissolve and become the **Great Mysterious (太玄)**."*

Moreover, **quicklime (胡粉)** is **lead burned (铅烧成)**, and **refined again (再炼)**, it **returns to its lead form (却归铅体)**. **Ice and snow (冰雪)** are **water congealed (水结成)**, yet **warmth’s qi (温暖之炁)** restores it to **water’s nature (水质)**. A man **begins young (年少)**, but with **ultimate refinement (至精)** and ingestion, he **reverts to childlike vigor (返其童颜)**, **returning to youthful essence (还归少质)**."

This is the **earnest instruction (殷勤教谕)** of ancient sages to **fellow seekers (同志之士)**. It also **pities this age’s people (哀悯当世之人)**, who **covet life yet lose principle (贪生失理)**, **cut down by sounds and colors (夭枉於声色)**, **withered by tastes and flavors (衰悴於滋味)**—thus their **Primordial qi (元炁)** **gradually decays (渐衰)**, and the **Great Destiny (大期)** **approaches silently (奄至)**. Hence, I **diligently expound (孜孜着论)**, warning those of the **future (将来者)**.

My **Primordial Origin Great Sage (玄元大圣)** is the **Sand of Martial and Civil Dao (文武神化)**—nothing more than the **true nature of Yellow Sprout (黄芽真性)**—the **Teaching of Primordial Origin (玄元之教)**. Thus, the term **Yellow Sprout (黄芽)** cannot be **sought by will (意求)** or **mastered by method (法则)** alone. **Heavenly Immortal’s secret arts (天仙秘术)** were transmitted by the ancients—**only through oral instructions (口诀)** can one **sequentially learn (递递为师)**. Do not **recklessly reveal (轻泄)** these truths. Without grasping their **marvelous principles (妙理)**, do not **arbitrarily entertain strange thoughts (异端之心)**.

it **assists in forming the Immortal’s divine elixir** (助成仙人神丹胎),
and **none can do without it** (无不用之).
To use it, one must **avoid ghostly flames** (无鬼焰).

**Green Vitriol** (曾青) shares **its fundamental affinity** (同本类) with **one color** (一色),
but **only possesses the divine transformation** (独有神化之功),
**drawing mercury’s qi** (引水银之炁),
**flowing and dispersing through the hundred meridians** (流散百脉).

If **practiced alone** (独行一门),
it can **transform the five metals into worldly treasures** (化五金为世宝).
When **used in its liquid form** (用化为液),
the **five metals** (五金) encounter it,
and **none fail to change** (无不变改).

**The mercury method** (水银一门):
**Immortal elixir—White and Vermilion Cinnabar** (仙丹白朱砂宝),
is **Heaven-born Sprout** (天生芽).
It **originates from mercury** (本从水银中生),
its **spirit unaltered** (精神不变),
and when it **forms White Cinnabar** (成白朱砂者),
it is then called **Heaven-born Sprout** (始名天生芽).
If one **attains this sprout** (得此芽),
**mercury will be subdued and transformed** (水银无不伏化).

Now, **Daoists lack Heaven-born Sprout** (今道士无天生芽),
so why not **borrow qi to form White Cinnabar Sand** (借炁而成白丹砂),
and thus **align with its grand transformation** (即同其大造化)?

**Ancient Immortals** (上古仙士) established the **Grand Transformation** (立言大造化),
using **Heaven and Earth as the furnace** (天地为炉),
and the **four seasons as fuel** (四时为炭).
If one **refines with pure and profound understanding** (纯妙用),
it also **aligns with the Grand Transformation** (亦同大造化),
and does not **need to seek distant models** (不在远取其则).

Yet, **the Three Ones must be mutually required** (然三一相须),
their **positions differ** (其居不同),
but their **purpose is singular** (其致一也).
If the **types and applications diverge** (若种类不同),
and **intentions vary** (用意参差),
then **divided into two paths** (分两有异),
how can one **understand and extract** (如何解摘)?
Only **my divine transformation secret arts** (唯我神化秘术),
**trust and follow** (信心所从).

**The Doctrine of Their Affinities: Divine Elixir Palace** (配合神丹宫相类门第十四)
**The Three Souls** (三魂):
**Mercury’s spirit and vital breath** (水银灵魄),
**form the three grades of Immortal elixir** (成三品神仙之丹).

From **the Three Ones** (从三一起),
**separating the Dao-principles** (分别道元),
**one generates two** (一生二),
**two generates three** (二生三),
and **three generates the Three Talents** (三生三才).
**The three elixirs align in affinity** (三丹相类),
**divine symbols like White Snow** (神符白雪),
**Nine-turned Golden Cinnabar** (九转金掖),
**from the ninth to the ninth** (从九至九),
**its liquid is unbroken** (液之不断),
and **unbroken is the name of qi** (不断是有炁之名).

**Accumulating qi to perfection** (积炁成功),
it **becomes the Three Palaces of Upper Clarity** (为上清三宫).
The **first is called Purple Cloud Palace** (一名紫霞宫),
the **second is called Heavenly Sovereign’s Jade Palace** (二名天皇琼宫),
and the **third is called Purple Hall** (三名紫宸官).

**Heavenly One Palace** (天一宫) **unites with the Divine Elixir** (合神丹),
and **its three grades of elixir** (其三品丹),
**all belong to one method** (都在一门).
**The three substances within the medicine** (药中三物) **coalesce to form** (共成),
**entering Heavenly One Palace** (入天一宫).

If one **refines the divine symbols for the upper elixir** (修神符上丹),
**beginning from the Purple Cloud Palace** (从紫霞宫起首),
**from yellow to purple** (从黄至紫),
**without losing its original hue** (不夺旧色),
then it **cannot be named** (不可载其名).

**Heavenly One Palace** (天一宫) is the **greatest**.
The **Three Palaces** (三宫) are the **realms of the Three Purity** (三清之境),
**from the void and formless Purple Cloud Palace** (从虚无紫霞宫天皇前),
**all things, great saints, converge** (一切，大圣悉皆归集).

**without mixing, they align with the Grand Transformation of Heaven and Earth** (不杂亦同天地大造化).

**Ordinary mercury**, if **attained by Green Vitriol** (凡水银如得曾青),
**tested by fire and subdued** (以火试伏),
and placed **within the crucible** (而於鼎中),
its **spirit transforms into radiant brilliance** (其灵变光芒),
**fire burns without consuming it** (火烧不烬),
and it **becomes the Immortal’s elixir** (变成仙丹),
**responding to the true divine elixir of the Upper Immortal’s Heavenly Palace** (以应上仙天宫真神丹).

**transformed from the Jade Morning Lord** (从玉晨君化成),
and its **name derives from the White Snow** (其名因白雪而成道).

**the Five Elders of Primordial Beginning** (元始五老),
are the **highest revered by the Most High** (太上之尊).

**yet remains concealed within the human body** (下在人身中而伏藏).

one may **name it the Great Dao** (可名成大道).

**combined with alum** (合以矾石),
and **herbal medicines** (并草药相类),
**yellow elixir and niter** (黄丹、硝石) are **affinities** (相类).

**Metal aligns with wood** (金合木),
**water aligns with fire** (水合火),
**qi aligns with wind** (炁合风),
**yin aligns with yang** (阴合阳),
and **all align in affinities to form grades** (并相类成品),
**uniting qi with Dao** (以炁合道).

**All miscellaneous elixir formulas and medicines** (凡所置杂丹方药),
**lack transcendental efficacy** (并无出世之功),
yet **temporarily possess healing abilities** (暂有治疾之能).
If one **mixes this alum with the Immortal’s protective qi** (将此矾石杂类),
and **mercury is used as the elixir** (染我神仙之卫),
then **though it may temporarily reside** (水银为丹者，虽尔暂住),
**it will ultimately depart** (终久还去).

Moreover, **mercury’s nature is inherently slippery and pure** (且水银性自滑净),
**untainted by dust or filth** (不染诸尘垢).
**Daoists** (道士) **should not seek its affinities** (岂不相类求象),

the **Water position** (子，水位),
and the **substance of qi** (炁之质).
As the **fetal palace containing silver** (为含银胎),
its **silver fetus is yellow flower** (其银胎为黄花),
like **fire contained within wood** (如木中含火),
**seeking affinities and configuring qi of lead** (禀类相求，而配其炁铅).

The **white** (白者) is the **metal’s essence** (金精),
and the **qi** (炁者) is the **water’s foundation** (水基).
**Mercury internally contains the fire of harmony** (水银内含火熙),
symbolizing **fire within wood** (象木中含火).
**Water restrains fire** (水刑火),
**as the Wood position (卯) aligns with the Tiger position (寅) for fire** (为卯合寅为火),
called **Double Yang** (曰重阳),
with **fire concealed within** (火在其中伏藏).

Thus, the **Dao scripture says** (所以道经云):
*"Know the white and guard the qi"* (知白守炁).

chunks.original_text: 《易》曰：百姓日用，而不知其道。 五行水为初，一能生成万物。 ．道士岂不知神化之术，在其中也。 雄是铅中银，能化水中银为白液。 白液者，从雄以雌而化。 此其仙丹，上元玄教一品，号名神符丹字，出《五符经》中。 其次用曾青、空青、雄黄、雌黄、毗黄、硫黄、硝石、炮砂、戎盥、铅华，铅华是铅中银精别名，已上等药，助成上道，亦须当用之，日相类同体。 即合於易象，不得失错。 若临炉定火，三才具全，天道共成，更无不利也。 若言三品上丹，并不用硝炮、矾石等之类。 若《港通诀》五金制度，在世利之门，即须用矾石，相类制引，使其通利，助佐其门，不用不成。 如为小丹，治玲热之疾者，世人皆错用诸矾石，共制於水银，以助佐成丹者。 世人不识相类，浪取其根，纵服得病暂除，不知元是患人有命，非干丹事，必取无端。 何也。 人五藏不纳诸矾。 又说按诸草药方书，多载用白矾之类，火化为生熟元，不易矾性。 如生水银死了，岂兔离水银之性乎。 熟饭岂兔生米之性乎。 只为用时较生，生即性急，使即疾速，熟即和同，使即迟慢。 迟疾两炁终始，元是一般。 如人自少至老，元是一性，不可改易也。 唯我神丹三品，用炁相和，以炁相类，不失五行，配合两性，不遗水火之法，象其颜色，未越束西，相类成形，不离南北。 受炁行令周回，不出於八卦，役使筋骨，不过於曾青。 配合阴阳之精，变化不出於铅金白液，伏藏不过於水火，得志不过於水基。 隐形为神，硫黄第一。 毗黄一物，天一独行，雄雌硝炮，转白入黄，转黄入紫，相类品物，不出神丹。 杂错施行，大误其道。 配合口神丹伏炼相类门第十六 第一神丹神符，上品之丹。 其丹以炁相合，而成大丹，名日天镜。 铅中黄华为银，含在铅中，名黄华，盖其华池。 华池是水基，水基名曰雌，即银，是西方太白星宫，号庚辛少女，雌也。 铅精元炁为精华，名曰雄前者，十名雄铅黄华。 精炁能化水银，是以铅精炁为之中男，北方。 与兑西方雄铅也，作华池。 盖与金少女相合，为雌雄华池。 水银脱胎化白液，液正元为一炁者，水之基，水位在北方子位。 第二白雪，白雪乃从汞，为妮女之用，中还白雪配类，合道元本，众成一炁，别名号日特行丹。 何为众味，可得所扶，助成其炁。 造之甚易，得之甚难，何也。 由助佐臣第一曾青，乃天一木精也。 黄芽铅精，白液金精、秋石等，出阳入阴，禀天地之炁，通大道之正元。 一造永了，更无二功。 亦名金砂之丹，日月递加，硫黄为芽，青腰为使，调成金砂，周遭一雨，名出云霞。 相类得之，服而不死。 三丹相类，各禀其炁。 神符应春夏，白雪应三秋，九转应三冬，春夏属阳，阳者雄也。 铅黄芽神符也。 秋冬属阴，阴者雌也。 丹砂白汞，姥女白雪，白雪者丹阳也。 九转应三冬，何也。 神符应春夏，天色清明，发一年之号令，感万象而生成，应蠢动而受命，合四时，应八节，此亦上仙之丹，号曰神符。 其次白雪，三秋之首，凭寒露而成霜，积阴炁而为雪，从煞止煞，百草烬於灰尘，蠢动伏於地炁，号神化无穷特行之丹，服之永不死，造之永留根，不可思量。 第三九转，九转神符，亦名金液丹相类九九之数。

*"The common people use it daily, yet do not know its Dao."*

Water, the first of the Five Phases, alone can generate all things.
Does the Daoist not know the art of divine transformation within it?

The **male**—silver within lead—can transform mercury’s silver into **White Elixir**.
The **White Elixir** arises when the **male** and **female** mutually refine each other.

This is the **Immortal Pill**, the supreme grade of the **Mystic Teachings of the Upper Primordium**, named the **Divine Symbol Pill** in the *Five Symbol Scripture*.

Next, one uses **copper acetate (曾青)**, **malachite (空青)**, **realgar (雄黄)**, **orpiment (雌黄)**, **yellow arsenic sulfide (毗黄)**, **sulfur (硫黄)**, **saltpeter (硝石)**, **calcined sand (炮砂)**, **arsenic trioxide (戎盥)**, and **lead oxide (铅华)**—for **lead oxide** is another name for the refined essence of silver within lead. All these medicines assist in completing the **Dao**; they must be used according to their **resonant affinities**.

This aligns with the *Changes*’ symbols—never misapplied. When refining at the furnace, if the **Three Powers** are complete, the **Heavenly Dao** succeeds, and nothing fails.

As for the **Three-Grade Supreme Pill**, it does not use **saltpeter or alum** and their ilk. Yet in the *Harbor Passage Key*, the **Five Metals’ System** belongs to the **Worldly Utility Gate**, where alum must be used to **harmonize affinities**, making them **flow smoothly** and aiding the **Gate’s function**—omission renders it incomplete.

For **minor pills** treating **lingering fevers**, common folk mistakenly mix alum with mercury to assist in pill formation. They do not grasp **resonant affinities**, recklessly taking their roots. Even if illness temporarily abates, it is because the patient’s **fate** allows it—not the pill’s power. Such methods are **groundless**.

Why? The **Five Viscera** cannot absorb alum.

Just as **dead mercury** does not lose its **mercurial essence**, nor does **cooked rice** lose its **raw rice nature**. Only their **timing** differs—**raw** is **urgent**, **cooked** is **slow**. Its **concealment** never surpasses **water and fire**, and its **fulfillment** never exceeds **water’s foundation**.

**Hidden in form**, it is **Divine**—**sulfur** is supreme.
**Yellow arsenic sulfide**, a singular substance, moves alone as **Heaven’s One**. **Hermaphroditic saltpeter** transforms **white to yellow**, then **yellow to purple**, all **affinitive substances** never straying from the **Divine Pill**.

Misdirected combinations **greatly err in the Dao**.

**First Divine Pill: Divine Symbol, Supreme-Grade Pill.**
Its pill is formed by **harmonizing qi**, becoming the **Great Pill**, named **Heaven’s Mirror**.
The **yellow bloom within lead** is silver, contained in lead, called **Yellow Bloom**—its **bloom-pool**.
The **bloom-pool** is **water’s foundation**, named **female**, which is **silver**, the **Western Planet’s White Star Constellation**, called **Regents Geng and Xin, the Young Maiden**—the **female**.

Paired with the **Western Lead’s male**, it forms the **bloom-pool**.
It aligns with the **Golden Young Maiden**, becoming the **male-female bloom-pool**.
Mercury, **shedding its form**, becomes **White Elixir**. When the **Elixir’s essence is pure**, it is **one qi**—**water’s foundation**, its position in the **Northern Child Trigram**.

**Second: White Snow.**
**White Snow** arises from mercury, used for the **Maiden’s function**. **Returning White Snow** aligns by **category**, merges with the **Dao’s original essence**, and all **qi coalesces into one**. It is also called the **Special-Mission Pill**.

Why does it require **varied flavors** to be supported?
Its creation is easy, yet attainment is difficult. Why?
Because the **first assistant**, **copper acetate**, is **Heaven’s One, Wood’s essence**.
**Yellow-sprouted lead essence**, **White Elixir’s gold essence**, and **Autumn Stone**—all **enter yin from yang**, drawing **Heaven and Earth’s qi**, passing through the **Dao’s true essence**. Once forged, it is **permanent**; no second effort is needed.

Obtained by **affinity**, it is taken without death.

**Divine Symbol** responds to **spring and summer**,
**White Snow** to the **three autumns**,
**Nine Circulations** to the **three winters**.
Spring and summer belong to **yang—the male**.
**Lead’s yellow sprout** is the **Divine Symbol**.
Autumn and winter belong to **yin—the female**.
**Cinnabar and mercury** are the **Maiden’s White Snow**; **White Snow** is **yang’s cinnabar**.
**Nine Circulations** respond to the **three winters**—why?
**Divine Symbol** responds to **spring and summer**, when **heaven’s clarity** issues commands, **stirring all phenomena** to life, **responding to movement** and receiving **mandate**, aligning with the **four seasons** and the **eight nodes**. This is also the **Supreme Immortal’s Pill**, named **Divine Symbol**.

Next is **White Snow**, the **beginning of the three autumns**, relying on **chilling dew** to form **frost**, accumulating **yin-qi** into **snow**. It **checks and halts** (the heat), reducing all grasses to **ashes and dust**, while **movement retreats** into **earth-qi**. It is called the **Pill of Boundless Divine Transformation**, taken without death, its **creation** leaving **no trace**, beyond measure.

**Third: Nine Circulations.**
The **Nine-Circulation Divine Symbol** is also called the **Gold-Liquid Pill**, aligning with the **ninefold ninefold count**.

chunks.original_text: 初九用九转，相类九九之数。 初九用硫黄，硫黄是太阳。 以阳成阴，名曰纯乾。 纯乾成大造化炁，号九转。 九转合五行三才，得此丹象束方木，木王正纯乾。 十二月半，得正月节，解冻之春首，即神符为上功，九转为次功，白雪为武功，神符为文功，经天地以春为上也，神符功最大。 凡神仙之卫，不过三丹。 三丹三皇所造，其丹杂法，科有万数，不得品类相配，不在载於仙录之中。 九转使者用黄神胶，白雪使者用天一黄芽，同黄神胶为一房，神符使者用铅黄芽。 三品上丹，使用各别，造丹日不得错，其仙教即恐相类不同也。 而不涉入，自大谬也。 配合传熙相类门第十七 硝石、炮砂、雄黄、雌黄，此四者相类用炁，同於一般造伏，制水银成丹之化，有感炁之法，刊在要门。 分数有功，即天生类别。 其如雄黄类水银成金之炁，亦辅金之苗，亦成金之色。 其中用曾青为使，即是雄黄之类，同成炁也。 雌黄为阴，辅佐空青。 即是空青为使，亦同水银也。 硝石为臣，辅佐雄雌水银，如关闭门牖不走失也。 类同一家之人，亦同一国之君臣，无四夷诸杂之类，以破三才也。 凡制丹及黄白卫，不可过此四般为类也。 炮砂与五金，亦须借炁用之。 用须知其多少。 若不相类，则事不成。 凡万物皆然，非论至药。 修炼之门，取类同即合。 除此四味，别有横入者，是非多端，未可闻命。 配合波斯铅精相类门第十八十六门 波斯铅不损三才，为五符天镜，成我大丹，为黄芽，是毕天之上法。 波斯铅是白虎庚辛金铅，号西国黄芽。 嘉州铅以水银同於猛火中，炼成金色为黄芽，名破三才分金公二字，亦名坏性，纵成黄芽，号日中天之次法，法无三才也。 波斯铅如着水银，於猛火中炼如金色。 若未至金色，须百炼取金色，然后堪点化。 采黄华为芽用之，点输石及雄雌黄、空青等，成黄金为世宝，亦名毕天之法。 嘉州铅与硫黄，同炼水银成粉，将炼水银，成太一含化丹，亦名中天之法。 嘉州铅入硫黄，微微同销成汁，兼用大功力，水煮之，以盛器成水银，煮经一百日，其水银亦成丹用，亦成白银用之。 嘉州铅为华池，煮一切水银成质，号名真铅金公华池水。 波斯铅入水银，同於猛火中，炼取六两黄华，於熟丹砂，是阳药木精，柜中养一百日，修炼擎出，丸如梧桐子大，每日空心服一粒，律下，益心神，明目炁髭发。 不经二百日，白发再炁，是小功之法，知神仙之道不虚矣。 嘉州铅及杂州土，炼成为粉，烧成黄丹，亦成蜜陀僧，亦成胡粉。 作柜子伏丹药，堪为利用之门。 嘉州铅能成炁银，亦能成铜器，亦能抽铜晕成银。 波斯铅不用，入水银空炼一伏时，取黄华以制水银，无不伏者。 并空炼一伏时，取黄华将制水银成砂子。 若入火伏得住，亦名中丹。 若大药，即不用诸铅。 歌日：大药不用铅，用铅即须会。 会即三才全，不会坏物碎。 黄华皆凭铅，铅中有变改。 天地自全功，功成铅须退。 至药无二三，因铅始得会。 会本从心生，生须铅华在。 变法任铅情，不道不成盖。 盖是天镜也。 铅黄丹，世人亦将为黄芽铅。 胡粉，世人亦将为黄芽铅。 令伏火作器，受水银，亦号白金黄芽。 嘉州铅一斤百，炼成一两，白如雪。 下硫黄一两，用水飞水银一两，禹余粮、孔公孽各一两，先销成汁。

「**First: Nine Circulations.**
The **Nine-Circulation Divine Symbol** is also called the **Gold-Liquid Pill**, aligning with the **ninefold ninefold count**.

**Nine Circulations (of the Gold-Liquid Pill):**
The **Nine-Circulation** employs **sulfur** (硫黄), which is **Taiyang** (太阳). Using **yang** to generate **yin**, it is named **Pure Gan** (纯乾). **Pure Gan** forms the **Great Daoist Transformation Qi** (大造化炁), known as the **Nine-Circulation Pill**.

The **Nine-Circulation Pill** harmonizes the **Five Phases** (五行) and **Three Talents** (三才), obtaining this **Pill’s Daoist Symbol** to bind **Wood** (木), the **Wood Sovereign** (木王) now standing **Pure Gan**.

In the **midst of the twelfth month**, at the **true beginning of the first month’s node** (正月节), the **thawing spring** (解冻之春) marks the **Divine Symbol** as the **highest achievement**, the **Nine-Circulation Pill** as the **secondary achievement**, and **White Snow** as the **martial achievement**. The **Divine Symbol** is the **civil achievement**. Among the **Heaven-Earth Pill** (经天地), **spring** (春) is supreme, and the **Divine Symbol** has the greatest efficacy.

All **immortal’s protective arts** (神仙之卫) do not exceed these **three pills**. The **three pills** were created by the **Three Sovereigns** (三皇). Their pill-making methods are diverse, with myriad techniques, but those that fail to align in **rank and kind** (品类相配) are not recorded in the **Immortal’s Registry** (仙录).

The **Nine-Circulation Pill’s emissary** (使者) uses **Yellow God Glue** (黄神胶), the **White Snow Pill’s emissary** uses **Tianyi Sulfur** (天一黄芽), both being classified under **Yellow God Glue** (同黄神胶为一房). The **Divine Symbol Pill’s emissary** uses **lead with sulfur** (铅黄芽). These **three grades of supreme pills** (三品上丹) are distinct in their preparation; the **day of pill-making must not be mistaken**, lest the **immortal’s teachings** (仙教) diverge in kind.

**Failure to follow this kindred principle** (不涉入) is a **great error**. The **Seventeenth Gate of Aligning with Saltpeter and Sulfur** (配合传熙相类门第十七) involves **saltpeter** (硝石), **calcined realgar** (炮砂), **realgar** (雄黄), and **orpiment** (雌黄). These **four substances** are kindred in their **qi**, akin to general **subjugation techniques** (造伏), and can **refine mercury** (制水银) into **pill’s efficacy** (成丹之化). Their methods of **sensing qi** (感炁) are recorded in the **Key Gates** (要门).

Their **functions are distinct**, as **Heaven’s inherent categorization** (天生类别) dictates. For instance, **realgar** (雄黄) is kindred to **mercury** (水银) in forming **golden qi** (成金之炁), nurturing **gold’s essence** (辅金之苗), and producing **gold’s hue** (成金之色). When **cupric acetate** (曾青) is used as an **emissary** (使), it belongs to the **realgar kind**, forming **qi** in the same manner.

**Orpiment** (雌黄) is **yin**, assisting **void green** (空青). When **void green** is used as an **emissary**, it is also akin to **mercury**. **Saltpeter** (硝石) is the **minister** (臣), aiding **realgar, orpiment, and mercury** like **shutting and sealing doors and windows** (关闭门牖) to prevent loss.

They are akin to **one family’s members** (一家之人) or **one kingdom’s sovereign and ministers** (一国之君臣), without **barbarian or杂州** (四夷诸杂) interlopers, to **break the Three Talents** (破三才). In **all pill-making and protective arts of yellow and white** (黄白卫), one must not exceed these **four kindred substances** (四般为类).

**Calcined realgar** (炮砂) and the **Five Metals** (五金) must also **borrow qi** (借炁) for use. Their **dosage** must be known. If not aligned in kind, the **endeavor fails** (事不成). All **ten thousand things** (万物) follow this principle; it is not limited to **elixirs**. The **Gate of Refining** (修炼之门) succeeds when kindred substances are aligned.

**Beyond these four ingredients**, there are **others that intrude**, leading to **many contradictions** (非端多端). These are **not to be revealed** (未可闻命).

**The Eighteenth Gate of Aligning with Persian Lead** (配合波斯铅精相类门第十八):
**Persian lead** (波斯铅) does not harm the **Three Talents** (三才), becoming the **Five Pill’s Heavenly Mirror** (五符天镜), forming **my great pill** (我大丹), and serving as **Yellow Ke** (黄芽), the **highest law of the heavens** (毕天之上法). **Persian lead** is the **White Tiger** (白虎) **regal metal** (庚辛金铅), named **Western Country’s Yellow Ke** (西国黄芽).

**Lead from Jiayou** (嘉州铅) refined with **mercury** in **fierce fire** (猛火) until it turns **golden** is called **Yellow Ke**, bearing the **two characters: "Break the Three Talents, Divide the Gold"** (破三才分金公二字). It is also named **"Corrupt Nature"** (坏性), though it forms **Yellow Ke**, it is the **secondary law of the heavens** (日中天之次法), lacking the **Three Talents**.

**Persian lead** refined with **mercury** in **fierce fire** until it turns **golden** must be **a hundred refineries** (百炼) to achieve the **golden hue**, then it can be used for **transmutation** (点化).

**Adopted yellow flowers** (黄华) are used as **ke** (芽). **Transfuse and inject** (点输) into **stone** (石) and **realgar, orpiment, void green** (雄雌黄、空青), forming **Yellow Gold** (黄金) as the **treasure of the world** (世宝), also named **"Heaven’s Ultimate Law"** (毕天之法).

**Jiayou lead** (嘉州铅) and **sulfur** (硫黄), refined with **mercury** into **powder**, are used to **refine mercury** into the **Taiyi Pill of Contained Transformation** (太一含化丹), also named **"Central Heaven’s Law"** (中天之法).

**Jiayou lead** (嘉州铅) mixed with **sulfur** (硫黄) is **slightly consumed** (微微同销) into a **liquid**, using **greatest efficacy** (大功力). **Boiled in water** (水煮) for **a hundred days** (一百日), the **refining vessel** (盛器) yields **mercury** (成水银), which is also used as a **pill** (成丹用). The **Jiayou lead** is called **Hua Chi** (华池), refining **all mercury** into **substance** (成质), known as **True Lead, Golden Sovereign, Hua Chi Water** (真铅金公华池水).

**Persian lead** (波斯铅) mixed with **mercury** (水银), refined in **fierce fire** (猛火), yields **six liang of yellow flowers** (六两黄华). When **mercury is refined** (熟丹砂), it is the **yang elixir, Wood Essence** (阳药木精). **Stored in a cabinet** (柜中) for **a hundred days** (养一百日), **refined and purified** (修炼擎出), the **pills** are formed like **Firmiana seeds** (梧桐子大), to be taken **one grain daily on an empty stomach** (每日空心服一粒). Following the **regulations**, it **enhances the mind and spirit** (益心神), **sharpens vision** (明目), and **revives qi, beard, and hair** (炁髭发).

If **not taken for two hundred days** (不经二百日), **gray hair rejuvenates** (再炁), which is the **minor efficacy’s law** (小功之法). One knows that the **Dao of Immortals** (神仙之道) is **not false**.

**Jiayou lead** (嘉州铅) and **杂州 soil** (杂州土), refined into **powder** (为粉), **burned** to form **Yellow Pill** (成黄丹), also known as **Mieduo Seng** (蜜陀僧) or **Hufa** (胡粉). These are used to **make cabinets** (作柜子) for **subjugating elixirs** (伏丹药), serving as **gates for beneficial use** (堪为利用之门).

**Jiayou lead** (嘉州铅) can form **elixir silver** (炁银), **copperware** (铜器), and **extract copper’s bloom** (抽铜晕) to make **silver**. **Persian lead** (波斯铅) is **not used**; if **mercury is refined alone** (空炼) for **one subjugation cycle** (一伏时), **yellow flowers** (黄华) are taken to **refine mercury** (制水银), ensuring **no loss** (无不伏者).

**Refined alone for one cycle**, taking **yellow flowers** to **refine mercury** into **cinnabar powder** (成砂子). If it **endures fire in subjugation** (入火伏得住), it is also named **"Central Pill"** (中丹). For **great elixirs** (大药), **all leads are not used**.

**Song (Chant):**
*"Great elixir does not use lead,
Use lead and it must align in kind.
Align in kind and the Three Talents are complete,
Fail to align and things are ruined and shattered.
Yellow flowers all depend on lead,
Lead has transformations and changes.
Heaven and Earth are inherently complete,
Efficacy achieved and lead must withdraw.
Ultimate elixirs have no second or third,
Lead’s alignment brings them to completion.
Completion stems from the mind’s intent,
Intent requires lead and yellow flowers present.
Altering methods follow lead’s nature,
Without the Dao, success cannot be assured.
Assured is the Heavenly Mirror’s efficacy.
Lead-Yellow Pill,
The world also calls it Yellow Ke Lead.
Hufa,
The world also calls it Yellow Ke Lead.
For subjugating fire to make vessels,
To receive mercury,
It is also named White Gold, Yellow Ke.
**Jiayou lead**—one hundred catties (斤),
Refined into **two liang** (一两), **white as snow**.
Add **one liang of sulfur** (硫黄),
Use **one liang of mercury** (水银) refined by **water-flying** (水飞),
**Yuyu Grain** (禹余粮) and **Kong Gong Nuisance** (孔公孽) each **one liang**.
First, **consumed into liquid** (销成汁)."*

chunks.original_text: 然后下水银，次下硫黄，次下孔公孽、禹粮等，以竹枝子余搅之。 总待相容受出之，入磁盆中，细研成一段紫粉。 又入坩埚中，密固济烧百日，用火不下一斤。 烧毕，出之细研成粉，绢袋盛，悬入地坑中，三日出之。 於磁合中盛饭，上蒸两遍，以人乳汁，和为梧桐子大，空心服一丸。 初日用酒下，增至十丸，即止，后并用津下。 服经百日，益人颜色，炁髭发，亦可以休粮，此是道门次中之药，即无出世之路。 何也。 此绿非类无质之物，然且要知铅中，有不思议无量之功，与仙道抗行。 若要休粮服食，治风病，即可无长生出世之大功矣。 波斯铅华池，能与曾青成合，五金相变易世宝，独行为一使。 所用方法，在秘要诀中。 但铅有华池，能煮炼五金，伏火如能解，感炁相类，用药分数，不失其理，於华池中有，毕天大造化之功力。 道士切须在意，参详上件铅功，有十六门之法，齐天地之道，解修炼者为仙人矣。 及有世财，并出此铅中，兼有变形容作处子之力，长生久视之功，毕天地之门，皆出於此也。 但得其真诀，无不定矣。 今略而记述之。

**Chapter Nineteen: The Method of Lateral Qi Communication—The Gate of Resemblance**

The method of lateral *qi* communication relies on subduing the Three Yellows and the Eight Stones. One must not alter their original essence, allowing each to subdue fire.

When subduing fire, one must not let it consume or scorch—all this is due to the lateral use of *qi*, guiding *qi* back to its true nature, so that its fundamental essence remains unchanged. This is called the "subdued fire of the Three Yellows."

The methods for subduing these medicines are like the eclipse of the sun and moon: though temporarily obscured, they ultimately return to clarity, reverting to their original essence.

The methods for subduing the Three Yellows also require the power of saltpeter. Saltpeter is named Autumn Stone.

Why is it called Autumn Stone? Daoist practitioners of flying elixir must know its origin. The Autumn Stone—these Three Yellows—belong to the *qi* of Spring’s Grand Solar Yang, which is killed in Autumn; thus, saltpeter can subdue yang medicines. If one subdues the Three Yellows without using saltpeter, the yang toxicity will never dissipate.

The Three Yellows and Eight Stones all belong to fire, being pure yang *qi*. Their generation is akin to that of mercury, but mercury, when subdued by fire, becomes dry silver, retaining its original form. The Three Yellows and Eight Stones are all born of yang *qi*—how could one know their transformations?

But if one subdues the Two Yellows and Eight Stones without altering their original essence, their efficacy is boundless—this is entirely due to the power of Autumn Stone.

Thus, Autumn Stone is the sovereign of yang medicines. When using medicines, mastering their profound principles is like a sage ruler obtaining virtuous ministers. Autumn Stone is that minister.

The method for subduing saltpeter begins with obtaining white cinnabar stone, refining it with fire and water into powder, then using it to subdue Autumn Stone. Autumn Stone originally forms in cold, sunlit places, accumulating frost and ice to become white cinnabar—a product of ancient, congealed ice-earth, forming a white stone bed. From this bed, cinnabar emerges. Saltpeter, being of similar *qi*, is used in lateral communication to subdue mercury and cinnabar, preventing their essences from dispersing.

Thus, Autumn Stone is of the same primordial category. When subduing the Three Yellows and Eight Stones with it, the utmost yin can restrain and subdue them without altering their true form—this is due to the innate natures of these two medicines.

Next, sulfur is paired with Autumn Stone. Sulfur originally derives from saltpeter, inherently bearing a white hue. Though sulfur itself has not been subdued by fire, when paired with saltpeter and used in lateral *qi* communication, it strengthens the power of Autumn Stone and saltpeter.

**Chapter Twenty: The Gate of Resemblance—Pairing Methods**

Take Persian lead, which originates from the west’s *gēng-xīn* metals (iron and mercury). Lead contains gold, with its floral essence resembling the west’s *gēng-xīn* metals, while its substance resembles the north’s *rén-guǐ* water. Thus, ancient immortals recognized the floral essence of lead as the Yellow Sprout.

Yet those who extract only from lead’s exterior resemble *qi* of the same category in use—within one substance, gold and water are generated together. This is called "resemblance," referring to form and essence.

The *Yin Lord* and *Bóhé Master* explain: The *Primordial Teachings* of the Celestial Worthy originated from the Flowing Sands, where it was named "paired lead." Han Dynasty lead, though having floral essence, lacks purity, differing from the Flowing Sands lead of the Western lands. The Most High thus ordained the Flowing Sands lead as the true lead.

Obtaining Flowing Sands lead yields the Three Grades of Dan Gold, the first true lead of the immortals. The *Primordial Teachings* of the Mysterious Embryo are named Flowing Sands lead—this is Persian lead.

Its paired lead within is like a person possessing talent and skill—both are inherent, not outwardly displayed. Thus, according to the *Lingbao Five Talismans*, "The adept who does not return to the elixir embraces its pure flow; if the child obtains it, the True Person may be sought."

If lead is used without harming the Three Realms, it becomes the supreme medicine of Heaven. If it harms the Three Realms, its floral essence must be extracted. If its floral essence is extracted, the lead loses its *qi* and power. Though still taken from lead, it will never be true—unworthy to serve as minister or assistant.

Why is lead’s power incomplete? Because its original *qi* is lacking, and its true nature is impaired.

If the Three Realms remain whole, this is the supreme method of Heaven. If its floral essence is extracted, this is the secondary method of the Middle Realm. If used as an auxiliary, this is the inferior method of the Middle Realm. These three methods all stem from the sixteen gates of lead.

If one seeks to use them, one must clearly understand the Great Dao’s Primordial Teachings—without error—thus achieving the Three Dan methods, corresponding to the Three One Palaces. The Three Palaces are the Three Purities: Supreme Purity, Upper Purity, and Jade Purity, unified as the One Primordial Palace of Heaven.

The Three Dans must encompass the true natures of the Three Realms: lead, mercury, and sulfur. Malachite serves as a unique envoy, embodying the true nature of the Eastern lands. The East is the first of the four seasons, generating all things—nothing is untouched by its influence. Thus, malachite is the envoy of lead, the sinews and bones of mercury.

Like wood containing fire, it can make lead, mercury, and sulfur into the Yellow Divine Glue, providing the *qi* and power of ministers and assistants.

If one refines the elixir without understanding the principles of the Three Realms, recklessly using the Five Metals and Eight Stones, even if one achieves lead elixir, consuming five grains will turn one’s beard and hair white in ten days, making one’s face like a maiden’s. Though this may seem miraculous, it lacks the function of transcending the world and prolonging life—exhaustion leads to death.

But if the Three Realms are complete, and the elixir is refined with proper resemblance, consuming it will make one’s body eternal, with lifespan equal to Heaven and Earth.

Thus, since the division of Heaven and Earth, only the Green Waist Envoy was known. Later generations did not understand the Primordial Teachings’ transformations, nor how to extract the *qi* of the four seasons, nor how to draw upon spring, summer, autumn, and winter to form the Yellow Sprout. Unable to transcend the world, they lack even minor alchemical gates.
